title: llvm-2.9: llvm-ld-2.9 generates broken wrapper scripts

sentences.text: When llvm-ld-2.9 is asked to link bitcode files, it normally creates a wrapper script as output, and a .bc file that the wrapper executes via lli.
The wrapper created for an output file "x" looks like:
However, lli is not part of the llvm-2.9-runtime package, but lli-2.9 is - I think the wrapper should default to lli-2.9, not lli.
Versions of packages llvm-2.9 depends on:
hi  libc6                         2.11.2-10  Embedded GNU C Library: Shared lib
ii  libffi5                       3.0.9-3    Foreign Function Interface library
ii  libstdc++6                    4.6.0-10   The GNU Standard C++ Library v3
Le samedi 26 novembre 2011  06:36 +0100, Marc Lehmann a crit :
> When llvm-ld-2.9 is asked to link bitcode files, it normally creates > a wrapper script as output, and a .bc file that the wrapper executes via lli.
> The wrapper created for an output file "x" looks like:
Could you provide a way to regenerate this script ?
Le samedi 26 novembre 2011  06:36 +0100, Marc Lehmann a crit :
> When llvm-ld-2.9 is asked to link bitcode files, it normally creates > a wrapper script as output, and a .bc file that the wrapper executes via lli.

> However, lli is not part of the llvm-2.9-runtime package, but lli-2.9 is -
> I think the wrapper should default to lli-2.9, not lli.
Could you provide a way to regenerate this script ?
On Sat, Dec 10, 2011 at 10:14:52PM +0100, Sylvestre Ledru <sylvestre@debian.org> wrote:
> Could you provide a way to regenerate this script ?
Oh, many times sorry, I completely forgot you :(
Take any bitcode object file (e.g. http://data.plan9.de/xx.bc) and link it with llvm-ld-2.9:
this generates a script called "xx" which tries to call lli instead of lli-2.9.
The choice of a       Deliantra, the free code+content MORPG
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of llvm-2.9, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 650065@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Sylvestre Ledru <sylvestre@debian.org> (supplier of updated llvm-2.9 package)
